definition: ancient Central Asian city state, flourished in first millennium AD, in modern Aksu 阿克蘇地區|阿克苏地区, Xinjiang

sentences.english: Starting from this point of view, the author expounded the Model of Qiuci Grotto art.
sentences.chinese: 全文从这种观点出发，论述了龟兹石窟艺术模式。
第二部分，龟兹乐舞文化。

sentences.english: Reports say the explosions took place in Kuqa province (County) in the south of the region.
sentences.chinese: 报道称爆炸发生在这一地区的南部一个叫龟兹的县。

sentences.english: A master-prentice system was created here and spread into inland China.
sentences.chinese: 二龟兹开始创立了师徒传承的体制，并影响到内地。

definition: Shule ancient name for modern Kashgar/Shule county in Kashgar prefecture 喀什地區|喀什地区[Ka1 shi2 di4 qu1], west Xinjiang
Tuyuhun, a Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑 nomadic people/a state in Qinhai in 4th-7th century AD
Shule, oasis state in central Asia (near modern Kashgar) at different historical periods
Western Regions (Han Dynasty term for regions beyond Yumen Pass 玉門關|玉门关[Yu4 men2 Guan1])
Huihe, pre-Tang name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur
Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
Tubo or Tufan, old name for Tibet/the Tibetan Tubo dynasty 7th-11th century AD/also pr. [Tu3 fan1]
the Greater Yuezhi, a branch of the Yuezhi 月氏[Yue4 zhi1] people of central Asia during the Han dynasty
Liangzhou district of Wuwei city 武威市[Wu3 wei1 shi4], Gansu
ancient people of central Asia during the Han dynasty
Ganzhou district of Zhangye city 張掖市|张掖市[Zhang1 ye4 shi4], Gansu
Wusun kingdom of central Asia (c. 300 BC-300 AD)
